text: A hybrid track day car with no turbos. Excellent. Yesterday we had the track-only McLaren P1 GTR. Today, we have its direct rival from Italy. Welcome to Better Than Coffee, your daily dose of car sounds designed to help you kick that caffeine habit. While the McLaren has to make do with just 986 horsepower, Ferrari's track car has a full 50 more, 1036. Four digits. Its aero is active and it's even more extreme than we thought a track-only car could be. Enjoy. Travis is an editor at Road & Track. He was previously the Editor-in-Chief of Jalopnik.com and is a little too fond of the Mazda Miata. title: The Ferrari FXX K Sounds Maniacal
